answers.answer: Your dog may have other concurrent endocrine disorders such as hyperadrenocorticism (Cushing's Syndrome), and/or hypothyroidism.  Other possibilities include heart disease, hepatomegaly or lung disease, a lesion in his nose, a nasal foreign body, tooth root abscess or allergies, and other, more unusual possibilities.  The problems could be unrelated.  Therefore, he really needs to have appropriate blood work and X-Rays and another exam.I hope you that your dog is on a grain free, high protein diet for his diabetes and to help him lose weight.  Essiac tea plus (available on line) is helpful for diabetes also.

question: our dog recently had trouble breathing for about a 30 second span.  He was sitting next to us and suddenly started breathing heavily only through his nose and making loud snorting noises.  We thought he was having a heart attack or a stroke.  I had him lay down and after this episode, he was fine, but shaken up.  He also sneezes alot and occasionally, while sleeping, will overheat and pant upon awakening, or if asleep, will have rapid breathing through the nose.  He has also had an occasional runny (clear) nose and discharge from right eye (which seems to be gone today). He has diabetes, is on 17 units of insulin 2x per day, and is a bit overweight.  He gets tired easily while playing at the dog park. any ideas of what may be going on with our friend?  thank you, in advance.
title: sneezy and such
